channel.title: Comments on: 2011 Goals: Bring It On
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Lee Marquez
item.dc:creator: Lee Marquez
item.description: I agree that everyone of has would want to pursue our goals each year.
item.content:encoded: I agree that everyone of has would want to pursue our goals each year.

item.title: By: Justin Dearing
item.dc:creator: Justin Dearing
item.content:encoded:
I love the goals. I should probably write some down myself.

If your ever in the NYC/Long Island area, let me know if you want to speak at a user group. I attend a few and used to run LIPHP. I don’t think we have any SQL Server user groups, but I’m sure you could speak on topics of interest to the .NET groups.

item.title: By: Tom Strike
item.dc:creator: Tom Strike
item.content:encoded:
Hi Jes,
I’ll be very surprised if you don’t manage to succeed on every front this year. You’re already accomplishing the “help others” goal; reading your list has forced to to do one of my own. And, your adventures in cooking have made me decide to learn how myself. I’m tired of reading about what you’re pulling out of the slow cooker while I’m microwaving something or slapping some lunch meat on bread. It’ll probably make my Dr. happy too when he checks my cholesterol and blood sugar level. ðŸ™‚

See ya at SQLSAT in East Iowa again and in Chicago. Stacy will be in Chicago, he’s going to work for Microsoft in January, and maybe we can get Jason, Kendra and the rest of the group from SQLSAT 50 to go out again. I haven’t had so much fun in years. And I still intend the write that blog post on “How many DBA’s does it take to find a bar.”
